item.title: Go - Step by step guide for implementing tracing on a microservices architecture (2/2)
item.description: This article is the second of a series of two. If you had not read the first one, you can do it here. In this post we are going to finish the implementation of the checkout-service and the stock-service and wrap up the proof of concept. Revisiting the flow In the previous article we finished with the gateway, and while doing so we defined the proto files required for both gateway and checkout-service.

item.title: Go - Step by step guide for implementing tracing on a microservices architecture (1/2)
item.description: This article is the first of a series of two. In this first one we are going to talk about what is tracing is used for, the scope of this proof of concept and implement the first service. What is the problem? Nowadays everyone wants to do microservices, it is a buzzword on every tech start up and while it brings a lot of benefits into the table it also brings some drawbacks that not everyone is aware at first.
